title: A Letter to the Learned Mr. Henry Dodwell
sourceDesc: In 1706, Clarke published a [Letter to Mr Dodwell], in response to his [Epistolary Discourse]. Shortly after, Collins published a [Letter to the Learned Mr. Henry Dodwell], as a direct response to Clarke's criticisms. A series of public letters between Clarke and Collins followed over the next few years, furthering the debate. They were never published as a set, but it was thought convenient to reproduce them here in that fashion.
author: Anthony Collins

blocks.content:
A Letter to the Learned Mr. Henry Dodwell;
Containing some Remarks on a (pretended) Demonstration of the Immateriality and Natural Immortality of the Soul, in Mr. Clark's Answer to his late Epistolary Discouse, &c.
